turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Look, either come in or stay out!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Shut the door, Lester. What do you think this is, a picnic?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: -- you'll be the prettiest thing in the room -- light's green...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: -- oh yeah... what do you know about this guy?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Jesus Christ, there's Norma Stern. Look at her hair.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Looks like somebody took a dump in it, that's the worst color job I've --

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: We're upstairs, George. Now come on. Behave yourself, and for Christ's sake, do me a favor. Don't let me drink too much.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You don't do that anymore, do you?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: That son of a bitch, everything he says is a phony piece of shit, what does he think, I'm some cigar butt he's got between his teeth --

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: C'mon, cunt, you're going for a walk.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He just completely ignores me. He could have at least said something, introduced me or something.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: -- Just get me out of here, baby. I can't stand it. It's killing me.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: -- why not? C'mon, take me out of here, somewhere I don't have to lie to anybody and I'll fuck your brains out, you little fiend, I adore you --

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Who's the greatest cocksucker in the world? C'mon --

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I don't know what gets into me.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: No, I blew it, I blew it with Lester.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You don't think so? I do.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You always say that... I really care for Lester, don't I?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I am you, you little bastard.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Where do you want to go?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: The lawn -- it looks like it goes on forever, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: -- look, you don't have to entertain me...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: -- well, if you feel like playing, go play...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: -- but you never were much of a tit man --

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well of course. Who loves a big fanny on a man?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: -- last night I dreamt I was fifty years old and Mary told me I was supposed to meet Jill at the shop. It seared me shitless.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I can't imagine being with Jill when she's fifty years old. I can't imagine not being with you.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: -- well you better go after her.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: -- yes, honey, you've got to get out of here.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Please, we'll have to talk later --

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Forget about last night, it's okay, we'll talk when I get back --

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It's not okay, I mean we've got to talk now. Where are you going?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Look -- either you leave or I leave because I don't want the two of us here when Lester arrives. I just don't --

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well then what are you trying to do-

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I want to marry you. I want to take care of you and I want your children, and I want you to be my girl. That's all I want. That's all I want out of my life, and it's a lot.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Jackie... Jackie?... answer me, for God's sake, answer me.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: If you knew how many times I wanted to hear you say that...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What's too late about it? Look, we're not dead, are we? That's the only thing that's too late.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Lester's left Felicia. He's taking me to Acapulco on the five o'clock flight. He's asked me to marry him.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: So what? You don't love him, do you? Answer me.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I can't just let him stand by the door...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I've got to... I've got to tell him where I am.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I don't know -- I've got to.

turns.speaker: RICCI
turns.text: Do you know what that Lillian Bercovici just did?

turns.speaker: RICCI
turns.text: She touched it! Then she played in it and got it all into something else. Now I don't know what it is!

turns.speaker: RICCI
turns.text: I can't even stand to talk to her on the phone.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: She's heavy.  See, Norman expects me to get in here, take care of all the customers and then do his show out in Norwalk. I gotta have my own shop, just out of self defense.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Hey, what's happening?  Mary! Telephone.  What's the matter?

turns.speaker: RICCI
turns.text: You were supposed to handle that bitch, she's always asking for you, and she was furious you weren't here.

turns.speaker: RICCI
turns.text: She's murdered her hair... you do something with her, I'm never going to touch her again.

turns.speaker: RICCI
turns.text: If I have to touch her again, I'll throw up!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Don't talk like a child. You're a pro, now get out there and cut!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: -- A brillo pad, I don't care, anything.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: -- You takin' a lot of shit lately, George.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: But then again you ask for it -- you just like my Otis -- can't keep his hands outta ladies' hair either.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: That boy always does great. He's a corporal or a squad leader or something, just wrote me from some place called Kwang Due?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't know if you don't know --

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What's wrong, Mary, are you drunk? Look, I've had a rough night, one of the roughest I've ever had, now I'm not in the mood for any sulking bullshit, what's wrong? Are you sick? Are you drunk? Can you work?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: -- you shouldn't talk to me like that no matter what, George... you know better...

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: -- you shouldn't do me like that...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: -- why did you come in today?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: -- left my bag, didn't have no money...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I guess you haven't heard from her yet.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: Nothing, my sister's back from Vegas.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: Nothing, I reconciled with Ron, you know, the guy I divorced last summer.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Great, great. I hope you make it.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't have your number, stop by the shop.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Well, it's a big canyon.  Honey, I'm sorry but I've gotta get back... just for a minute.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Let me come, too.  Please don't leave me alone.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I don't know... every once in a while I just get the feeling something awful's going to happen.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I don't know... just... somebody's going to get me.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I've had these dumb dreams lately.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: They're dumb, somebody... I don't know...

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I don't know. I can't remember. It was just in my dream.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Nobody's gonna get you. Now get inside.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You'll do what I tell you. Now get the fuck inside.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Nobody's gonna get you but me!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Great, great, fantastic. Fantastic. Incredible. Incredible, really incredible.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm gonna open the shop, baby, I'm gonna open the shop. I'm getting it together.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Right now -- I'm at the epitome of my life. Right now I feel so good I'm afraid something's gonna happen.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: When I was a little kid, I used to want to go to Europe but right now wherever I am I'm gonna be in Europe.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I just came from a meeting... I can't talk about it now, baby. But in a few days -- see I'm disgusted with my life.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I thought you said you were at the epitome of your life.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I am, I am. But I've had it with chicks. They're like an occupational hazard. Six guys working for me... I'm gonna retire or settle down or something.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Hey, baby -- I'm gonna retire with you.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: But in the same house, you know, one house.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Maybe you don't even like children.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: You've never even been around one.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm around you and I like you, don't I?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Not right now, I don't mean right now... but eventually...

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Jackie says she wouldn't bring children into this world. That it's hypocritical and overpopulated.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: They want me to go to Egypt for three weeks.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: How did it go at the bank?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Could I talk to you for a second?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I said I wasn't sure if I could go.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh, great, listen, baby, I gotta get back, okay?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Okay, but how did it go at the bank?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Hey, baby, say hello to Felicia.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: When can I talk to you?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Baby, I'm in the middle of work.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I know but this is important. I have to make a decision.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Honey, have they offered you the job?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: No, but I think they might.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Just a second, I'll be right with you...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: They didn't offer you the job yet.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I want your feelings about it.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Look, either we have a meaningful relationship or we don't, I've got to know.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Look, baby, can we talk about it later?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: But I never know when you're working and when you're not working!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: A business meeting, I told you that.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Look at the way I live.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I've been trying to reach you all afternoon. You weren't in the shop. What is this thing tonight?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What do you mean, what is it? It's some political bullshit.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I have to have Jackie ask me? Don't you think you could call me and let me know? Look at my hair.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Wait a minute, God-damn-it. Do you think I want to go to some God damned party? I'm trying to get that God damned shop open. I'm trying to get a little bread together. That's all I'm doing.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Maybe I should get a dog... no, it would just shit all over the house and I'd never clean it up.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Oh, honey. If we had one place, we could have a nicer place and I could take care of it. We're almost never here.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What does he direct besides traffic?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I've got to get her out of here.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: -- okay --  -- I'll see you later. Your house.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I don't want to fight, George.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't want to fight either. Look... uh -- I love you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: How come you took your own car?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I didn't want him meeting me here.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You didn't plan on fucking him tonight.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You did fuck him, didn't you?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Let go of me or I'll scream, I'll call the police.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You told him I was here and he wanted to know if I was beating you up.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Well, did you get a job out of it at least?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I'd like you to leave now.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Who knows, I'm sure you don't -- but if it'll help any, I found it in your bed.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: So who else was there besides Jackie? Huh?... huh?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Baby, don't do this. I do love you.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Obviously there were others, weren't there?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What do you wanna know for?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I just want to know, that's all.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I just want to know while we were seeing each other... I just don't want girls looking at me and knowing and me not knowing...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Baby, please don't... I love you.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I don't want to be a fool!... I want to look them in the eye and say, I know!

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: -- it'll help me if you'll tell me.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I'll know you've lied to me... all along. I'll know you're incapable of... love... that'll help me... not now, but eventually.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: ... well I'm glad you told me.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: ... honest. At least you're honest with me.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: That's all you've got to say?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: -- tell me something -- did you talk about me?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: George, if you keep this up I'm going to scream.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I said you were a loser!

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: I just needed a wash and set, a wash and set, that's all.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Well, baby, I'm George and it needs to be cut.  But I don't want to place you in that position either.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Felicia says you're a very good hairdresser.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: She says you're a fabulous hairdresser.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I didn't say it, she did. How'd you happen to get in that line of work?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh, well, I went to beauty school... you know you go to beauty school... and you get your operator's license... and you graduate... and you're a hairdresser.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: But the important thing is you're successful at it.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm better than the guy I work for.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Well, George, I invest for a lot of people. I make a lot of money for them. More than they could do for themselves.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: After a while that hurts... doesn't it?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: It's good you want to do something, George.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: But personal services are not the kind of thing I usually get into.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: No, they're a pain in the ass, there's no way of keeping track of anything. It's a cash business and you've got to watch your operators or they'll steal you blind, am I right or am I right?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Who needs that kind of aggravation? Who needs that kind of aggravation at my age? When I finish work I want to...

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: George, could you -- excuse us for a minute?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Felicia's really interested in the shop, isn't she?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Well, George, you may not think ten or fifteen grand means much to me, but I invest for myself and a lot of particular people.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh yeah? I mean I know.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: So I'm going to want a little more of your thinking on the subject.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Yeah, little election party I'm giving at the Bistro. It's a pain in the ass but -- I have to do it. We'll have a little time to talk there.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: -- maybe you could, on your way, you know, pick up Jackie here.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I wish my son knew what he wanted to do.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: -- Anything, I don't care what it is, just so it's something.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: That's okay, that's okay, just shut the door.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: That, and... I'll be done in a minute.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: You look like you've had quite a work-out.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It's nerve wracking sometimes... women can get you very upset.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I know it, I know it.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I know it, son. But tonight's going to be even tougher.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: George, I know you have to deal with Felicia and you're caught in the middle, and if you can just bear with me tonight, well, I appreciate the way you've handled the situation.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: It's a difficult situation, and I want you to know I appreciate it. Tonight's going to be real tough for me --

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Son, we'll do business, I can tell you that.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: -- do me a favor, kind of keep your eye on Jackie, she's a little high strung tonight --

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: See she doesn't drink too much.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Well -- I could try. Do you wash your hair every day?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No it keeps the skin peeling. You've got to keep the follicles open. You lose hair and the skin grows over the follicle and that's how you lose it.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: This really ought to be layered...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Well yeah, otherwise it just sort, you know, lies there -- layer so it kind of fluffs out --
